The purpose of the Vietnam HIV-Addiction Technology Transfer Center is to reduce the individual and societal harm due to HIV and substance use disorders in Vietnam by building the capacity of local institutions in the field of Substance Use Disorders, the primary vector for HIV transmission. The prime partner will provide TA to 2 universities that the government of VN have identified as providers of MMT capacity building. Based at Hanoi Medical University in the north and at HCMC School of Medicine in the south, the TBD IM will organize training programs for counselors and medical professionals, develop partnerships leaders, policymakers, and health professionals, and promote the principles of recovery-oriented systems of care. There is an urgent need for workforce development in the area of HIV & substance use disorders. The IM will draw upon the expertise of ATTC leaders in the U.S. to develop a counselor education curriculum & to train Vietnamese providers in clinical supervision. The proposed IM will support the role of TBD/HCMC as a hub for training & technical assistance for the development of SUD treatment services drawing upon previous work.
